required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ex Vivo Evaluation of Immunity Activation Face to S. Aureus Antigens and Adjuvants of a Vaccine Candidate in Cells From Haemodialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Ex Vivo Evaluation of Immunity Activation Face to Staphylococcus Aureus Antigens and Adjuvants of a Vaccine Candidate in Cells From Haemodialysis Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: S. aureus is a leading cause of severe infections notably in haemodialysis patients. These patients have a high risk of S. aureus nasal carriage, with a rate of persistent carriage near 30%. These carriers are particularly at risk of S. aureus infections as we previously shown. High risk of S. aureus infections such as bacteremia occurred notably in patients with dialysis catheters. Decolonization of carriers may prevent such infections however this approach has limits. Development of an effective S. aureus vaccine is crucial. To date, past vaccines tested (phase III) failed to achieve their end points. Target of only one or few antigens, absence of cellular response induction and possibly no impact on carriage are probably the reasons of the failures.

detailed_description.textblock: In an attempt to minimize failure in a clinical phase, ex vivo analysis of immune response of leucocytes of haemodialysis patients face to S. aureus and the impact of antigens and adjuvants of a candidate vaccine may help.

primary_outcome.measure: EX VIVO measure of innate immunity: functional capacity of neutrophils to S. aureus vaccine antigens
primary_outcome.description: Measured by blood samples at 0, 6 and 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: EX VIVO measure of innate immunity: induction of oxidative burst to S. aureus vaccine antigens
primary_outcome.description: Measured by blood samples 0, 6 and 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: EX VIVO measure of innate immunity : phenotype activation of different cell types from PBMCs (peripheral blood mononuclear cells) to S. aureus vaccine antigens
primary_outcome.description: Measured by blood samples 0, 6 and 12 months.

primary_outcome.measure: EX VIVO measures of innate immunity: chemokines and cytokines secretions to S. aureus vaccine antigens
primary_outcome.description: Measured by blood samples 0, 6 and 12 months.

primary_outcome.measure: EX VIVO measure of acquired immunity: measures of S. aureus antibodies titre in serum to S. aureus vaccine antigens
primary_outcome.description: Measured by blood samples 0, 6 and 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of persistant portage of S. aureus in the nose haemodialysis patients.
Analysis of the S. aureus clonal complexes of nasal carriage strains from haemodialysis patients.
Number of infection by S. aureus in new haemodialysis patients.
EX VIVO measure of innate immunity: functional capacity of neutrophils to S. aureus vaccine adjuvants
EX VIVO measure of innate immunity: induction of oxidative burst to S. aureus vaccine adjuvants
EX VIVO measure of innate immunity : phenotype activation of different cell types from PBMCs (peripheral blood mononuclear cells) to S. aureus vaccine adjuvants
EX VIVO measures of innate immunity: chemokines and cytokines secretions to S. aureus vaccine adjuvants
EX VIVO measure of acquired immunity: measures of S. aureus antibodies titre in serum to S. aureus vaccine adjuvants
Investigation of the presence of antigens of interest selected for the vaccine approach in strains of S. aureus in the nasal carriage
Survival rate to S.aureus in the whole blood
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by blood samples. Expressed in percentage

arm_group.description: There is an analyse of immune response against S. aureus from new haemodialysis patients by blood samples and nasal swabs.

intervention.description: Blood samples will be collected at inclusion, at 6 months and 12 months for hematological and immunological analyses.
Two nasal swabs will be collected at inclusion, at 6 months and 12 months for virology analyses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient starting haemodialysis for chronic hemodialysis.
- Patient starting haemodialysis on catheter
- Patient who signed the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant woman
- Patient who starts Haemodialysis for over 3 months
- Patient with anemia (hemoglobin <7 g / dL)

overall_official.affiliation: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne
